Stem: Numerous upright maturing to drooping, hairy and dark reddish-brown when young maturing to greyish brown and grooved. Flexible but not easily breakable.
Leaves: Oval-shaped with pointed tip, dark green on top and bluish-green and hairy underneath. 2-9 cm long.
Flowers: Male flowers yellow with no petals, female green with no petals, soft and fluffy, grouped in clusters.
FruitSeeds: Capsule that splits in 2, containing seeds with long silky hairs.
Habitat: Riparian areas, wetlands, swamps, wet forests, drains, alpine bogs.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from Black willow (*Salix nigra*) by smaller size, having more stems, and, hairy leaves.
